sections.body: This Act may be called the Cantonments Rent Restriction Act, 1963. It extends to all the cantonments in Pakistan. It shall come into force at once.

In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context, definitions of terms such as 'Additional Controller', 'building', 'Cantonment Board', 'commercial building', 'Controller', 'family', 'house', 'Landlord', 'prescribed', 'residential building', and 'tenant' are provided.

sections.section_title: Act not to apply to certain buildings
sections.body: Nothing contained in this Act shall apply to evacuee property or property owned by the Federal Government, Provincial Government, Railway, Port Trust, or any local authority.

The Federal Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, direct that all or any of the provisions of this Act shall not apply to any cantonment or to any particular building or class of buildings.
The provisions of this Act shall have effect notwithstanding anything inconsistent contained in any other law.
The Federal Government may appoint a person to be the Controller of Rents for one or more cantonments.

sections.section_title: Applications to be filed with controller
sections.body: Every application under this Act shall be filed with the Controller who shall either hear it himself or assign it to an Additional Controller.

sections.section_title: Power of controller to transfer cases
sections.body: The Controller may transfer any case pending before him to the Additional Controller for hearing and disposal.
The Controller shall fix fair rent for a building after holding an enquiry, considering factors such as local rent, cost of construction, and rental value.

sections.section_title: Increase of fair rent in certain cases
sections.body: Fair rent shall not be increased unless some addition, improvement, or alteration has been made at the landlord's expense.

sections.section_title: Landlord not to claim anything in excess of fair rent
sections.body: The landlord shall not claim or receive any premium or other sum in addition to fair rent.

sections.section_title: Fine or premium not to be charged for grant, renewal or continuance of tenancy
sections.body: No landlord shall require the payment of any fine, premium, or any other sum in addition to the rent.

sections.section_title: Moneys which should not have been paid may be recovered

The tenant is responsible for paying taxes.

sections.section_title: Landlord not to interfere with amenities enjoyed by the tenant
sections.body: The landlord shall not interfere with the amenities enjoyed by the tenant.
